title: Charlie Watts
content:
Some sad news this week: Rolling Stones drummer Charlie Woods died at age 80. I don’t know much about how music is made but I know what I like, and I’ve loved the Stones ever since I can remember. The first time I can ever remember being asked my favorite band, my answer was The Stones. 40-some years later, my answer is unchanged.

Mick Jagger — one of the most poetic, eloquent writers the world has known — had no words. Nor did Keith Richards. Ronnie Woods had but a few. I slag on social media frequently, and though Instagram has its problems, when it works, it works, and of all the major social platforms, it remains the one that’s primarily about sharing good thoughts and good feelings. It’s a mere token, but it feels good to press Like on posts like these, just to express, in some way, that we miss Charlie too.

Yesterday the band posted a short video tribute — set to, of course, the perfect song.

 ★
author: John Gruber
